article_title: With smoking even more deadly than previously thought, more aggressive preventive policies are needed

article_metadata.description: The death statistics for cigarette smoking are already very grim: The U.S. Surgeon General says that more than 480,000 American deaths each year can be attributed to the highly addictive habit.  That’s one of every five deaths in the United States.

og.description: The U.S. Surgeon General says that smoking causes more than 480,000 American deaths, but the true toll may be much higher according to research published in the NEJM.
og.title: With smoking even more deadly than previously thought, more aggressive preventive policies are needed
